saddle sore which, coming after all my previous journeys, quite prevents my riding and commanding so vast an army, so I have passed on the command to the gen- 
1 An old-fashioned wooden cart with a covered top.-TR. 
eral next in seniority, Count Buxhowden, hav- ing sent him my whole staff and all that be- longs to it, advising him if there is a lack of bread, to move farther into the interior of Prussia, for only one day's ration of bread re- mains, and in some regiments none at all, as reporte
